meanings.definition: To make something native or characteristic of a particular place or culture.
meanings.sent1: The artist indigenized traditional music by adding local instruments to the performance.
meanings.sent2: The chef indigenized the recipe by using locally sourced ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer indigenized the runway with a unique blend of traditional and modern styles.
meanings.sent4: The architect indigenized the building design, incorporating elements of the local culture.
meanings.sent5: The teacher indigenized the lesson by including stories from the community's history.

meanings.definition: To adapt or modify something to fit the customs or beliefs of a specific group.
meanings.sent1: She indigenized her speech to connect better with the audience.
meanings.sent2: The company indigenized their products to appeal to the local market.
meanings.sent3: He indigenized his wardrobe to match the dress code of the event.
meanings.sent4: The team indigenized their approach to teamwork to accommodate diverse perspectives.
meanings.sent5: They indigenized their traditions to honor the cultural heritage of the community.

meanings.definition: To incorporate indigenous elements into something.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant indigenized its menu by adding traditional dishes from the region.
meanings.sent2: The museum indigenized its exhibits to showcase the art of local tribes.
meanings.sent3: The festival indigenized its performances with traditional dances and music.
meanings.sent4: The garden indigenized its plant selection to support local wildlife.
meanings.sent5: The school indigenized its curriculum by including stories of indigenous peoples.
